question: A journey takes 4 hours 30 minutes at a speed of 60 km/hr. If the speed is 15 m/s, then the journey will take :
explanation:
$latex 60\\ km/hr = 60\\times \\frac{5}{18}\\ m/s = \\frac{50}{3}\\ m/s&s=1$
$latex \\therefore\\ Speed \\propto \\frac{1}{Time}&s=1$
$latex => S_{1}\\times T_{1} = S_{2}\\times T_{2}$
$latex => \\frac{50}{3}\\times \\frac{9}{2} = 15\\times T_{2}&s=1$
$latex => 75 = 15\\times T_{2}$
$latex => T_{2} = \\frac{75}{15} = 5\\ hours&s=1$
Hence option [A] is correct answer.
